response:
Google is a search engine that uses a web crawler to index web pages on the internet. It was founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin in 1998 while they were Ph.D. students at Stanford University in California. Google's search engine has become the most popular in the world, with over 90% of the market share.

In addition to its search engine, Google has expanded into various other areas, including online advertising, cloud computing, software development, and consumer electronics. Some of its most popular products include Google Ads, Google Maps, Google Drive, and Google Chrome.

Google is also known for its corporate culture, which emphasizes innovation, creativity, and collaboration. The company has been recognized as one of the best places to work in the world, with a focus on employee well-being and work-life balance.

Overall, Google is a powerful and influential company that has had a significant impact on the way people access and use information online. Its search engine has become an essential tool for millions of people around the world, and its other products and services have also become widely used and relied upon.
